item.title: Cond in Scala
item.description: This is probably one of the simplest articles I’ve written… except for the About section of this site… The reason I’m writing it is because I recently discovered a simple yet very useful function that facilitates the construction of an Either monad or a Validated monad. This function is called cond probably short for condition. Ans here is how it works: import cats.data.Validated def someFunction: Boolean = ??? val either: Either[String, String] = Either.
